agenda.description: ** REVISION ** SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Finance TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM, Monday, April 15, 2019 PLACE: E1.036 (Finance Room) CHAIR: Senator Jane Nelson All bills will be laid out before public testimony is taken. The Committee will recess at 10:45 for session and public testimony will resume after session. Those wishing to give public testimony, please limit prepared remarks to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please submit 40 copies, with your name on each copy, to the Assistant Clerk during the hearing. · Oral testimony: fill out a paper witness card and submit to the Assistant Clerk. · Oral and written testimony: fill out a paper witness card and hold on to your documents until your name is called to the table. · Position only: register using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to Http://swrs on public-capitol. · Written testimony only: register your position using the Senate kiosk then bring your 40 copies, with your name on each copy, to the Assistant Clerk, during the hearing. To consider the following: SB 66 Nelson | et al. Relating to the decrease of the rates of the franchise tax under certain circumstances and the expiration of that tax. SB 288 Miles Relating to the authority of a county assistance district to impose a sales and use tax. SB 412 Hughes Relating to a franchise tax credit based on the ad valorem taxes paid by a taxable entity on certain inventory. SB 570 Creighton Relating to a franchise tax credit for entities that employ certain students in certain paid internship or similar programs. SB 574 Miles Relating to a franchise tax credit for entities that establish a grocery store or healthy corner store in a food desert. SB 774 Creighton Relating to a franchise tax credit for taxable entities offering postsecondary tuition assistance. SB 1050 Hughes | et al. Relating to the creation and operation of a health care quality provider participation program; authorizing an administrative penalty. SB 1081 Taylor | et al. Relating to a deduction under the franchise tax for certain contracts with the federal government. SB 1143 Hughes Relating to the appraisal for ad valorem tax purposes of tangible personal property held for sale at retail and a franchise tax credit based on the ad valorem taxes paid on such property. SB 1417 Johnson Relating to phasing out the tax reduction for certain high-cost gas. SB 1481 Hinojosa Relating to the exemption from the franchise tax and certain filing fees for certain businesses owned by veterans during an initial period of operation in the state. SB 1824 Perry Relating to the exclusion from total revenue of certain payments made by a performing rights society for purposes of computing the franchise tax. SB 1869 Hinojosa Relating to a franchise tax credit for taxable entities that employ persons with disabilities. SB 2220 Bettencourt Relating to fees collected by the Automobile Burglary and Theft Prevention Authority. SB 2326 Creighton Relating to the franchise tax and alternative revenue sources and spending priorities for this state; repealing the franchise tax. ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions of the schedule **
